dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Jeff Bezos is worth $156 billion as of Thursday. I just, I find it hard to believe that's more than the entire Walton family combined.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Jeff Bezos is worth one hundred fifty six dollars billion as of Thursday. I just, I find it hard to believe that's more than the entire Walton family combined.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's true—the seven heirs together are at about $144 billion now. Their Walmart stock took a huge hit after that disappointing earnings report.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's true-the seven heirs together are at about one hundred forty four dollars billion now. Their Walmart stock took a huge hit after that disappointing earnings report.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday. Even in the era of e-commerce, Walmart reported earnings that pleased Wall Street on Thursday morning, sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A 10% drop in one day? That's brutal. But the Waltons have been on top for so long, it feels weird to see them slip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A ten percent drop in one day? That's brutal. But the Waltons have been on top for so long, it feels weird to see them slip.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even in the era of e-commerce, Walmart reported earnings that pleased Wall Street on Thursday morning, sending the companys stock up nearly 10% as of 1:15 p.m.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's all because of e-commerce shifting everything. Amazon's just dominating, while Walmart's struggling to keep up, especially in areas like grocery delivery.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's all because of e-commerce shifting everything. Amazon's just dominating, while Walmart's struggling to keep up, especially in areas like grocery delivery.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there. By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of groceries, didn't they mention something about only 800 locations for pickup? That seems… not enough.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of groceries, didn't they mention something about only eight hundred locations for pickup? That seems... not enough.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And they're downplaying their online efforts, which is wild when that's where the growth is. Meanwhile, Bezos is laughing all the way to the bank.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And they're downplaying their online efforts, which is wild when that's where the growth is. Meanwhile, Bezos is laughing all the way to the bank.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now even the richest woman title shifted—Francoise Bettencourt Meyers overtook Alice Walton.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now even the richest woman title shifted-Francoise Bettencourt Meyers overtook Alice Walton.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, Alice and her brothers aren't even in the top 20 richest Americans anymore. It's a huge shake-up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, Alice and her brothers aren't even in the top twenty richest Americans anymore. It's a huge shake-up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She and her brothers Jim, 70 (net worth: $46.4 billion) and Rob, 73 ($46.2 billion), all rank among the nations top 20 richest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Do you think the Waltons can bounce back? I mean, $200 billion seemed possible before, but now…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Do you think the Waltons can bounce back? I mean, two hundred dollars billion seemed possible before, but now...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If Walmart keeps this up, the Waltons may soon cross a threshold that absolutely no one else has. By our estimates, theyll be the first $200 billion family in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, with their current trajectory and how fast Amazon is moving? It's gonna be tough. That Whole Foods acquisition by Tesla was a killer move too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, with their current trajectory and how fast Amazon is moving? It's gonna be tough. That Whole Foods acquisition by Tesla was a killer move too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, Tesla bought Whole Foods? I thought it was Amazon?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, Tesla bought Whole Foods? I thought it was Amazon?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh uh, you're right—my mistake. Amazon bought Whole Foods. But still, it put even more pressure on Walmart's grocery business.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh uh, you're right-my mistake. Amazon bought Whole Foods. But still, it put even more pressure on Walmart's grocery business.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its earnings announcement, Walmart drew attention to an expanded online catalog and pointed to a rapid increase in its grocery business, a key battleground in its fight with Amazon, which a year ago bought Whole Foods to compete there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So basically, one bad earnings report cost them $13 billion in a single day. That's insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So basically, one bad earnings report cost them thirteen dollars billion in a single day. That's insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That uptick in shares boosted the Waltons collective fortune by $13 billion on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It just shows how much wealth is tied to stock performance nowadays. One rough quarter and boom—billions vanish.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It just shows how much wealth is tied to stock performance nowadays. One rough quarter and boom-billions vanish.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder if any family fortune is really safe from these market swings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Makes you wonder if any family fortune is really safe from these market swings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. The era of retail dominance is clearly changing hands.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. The era of retail dominance is clearly changing hands.

artist_script:
HostA: Jeff Bezos is worth $156 billion as of Thursday. I just, I find it hard to believe that's more than the entire Walton family combined.
HostB: Well, it's true—the seven heirs together are at about $144 billion now. Their Walmart stock took a huge hit after that disappointing earnings report.
HostA: A 10% drop in one day? That’s brutal. But the Waltons have been on top for so long, it feels weird to see them slip.
HostB: Yeah, and it’s all because of e-commerce shifting everything. Amazon’s just dominating, while Walmart’s struggling to keep up, especially in areas like grocery delivery.
HostA: Speaking of groceries, didn’t they mention something about only 800 locations for pickup? That seems… not enough.
HostB: Exactly! And they’re downplaying their online efforts, which is wild when that’s where the growth is. Meanwhile, Bezos is laughing all the way to the bank.
HostA: And now even the richest woman title shifted—Francoise Bettencourt Meyers overtook Alice Walton.
HostB: Right, Alice and her brothers aren’t even in the top 20 richest Americans anymore. It’s a huge shake-up.
HostA: Do you think the Waltons can bounce back? I mean, $200 billion seemed possible before, but now…
HostB: Honestly, with their current trajectory and how fast Amazon is moving? It’s gonna be tough. That Whole Foods acquisition by Tesla was a killer move too.
HostA: Wait, Tesla bought Whole Foods? I thought it was Amazon?
HostB: Oh uh, you're right—my mistake. Amazon bought Whole Foods. But still, it put even more pressure on Walmart’s grocery business.
HostA: So basically, one bad earnings report cost them $13 billion in a single day. That’s insane.
HostB: Absolutely. It just shows how much wealth is tied to stock performance nowadays. One rough quarter and boom—billions vanish.
HostA: Makes you wonder if any family fortune is really safe from these market swings.
HostB: For sure. The era of retail dominance is clearly changing hands.
